sentences.en: Not that the John Lewis tale has been an unbroken idyll.
sentences.cn: 约翰?刘易斯的故事并非毫无波澜的“田园诗”.

sentences.en: Of or having the nature of an idyll.
sentences.cn: 使人联想起牧歌;迷人的简朴和安静.

sentences.en: She finds that the sleepy town she moves to isn't the rural idyll she imagined.
sentences.cn: 她发现她搬进的这个寂静小镇并非她想象中的乡间田园。

sentences.en: She finds that the sleepy town she moves to isn'tthe rural idyll she imagined.

sentences.en: The application of idyll prospects is considered to be Kundera's innovation of the novel form.
sentences.cn: 同时也说明牧歌图景的运用是昆德拉对小说形式的大胆革新.

sentences.en: The love affair begins with the traditional boy - meets - girl idyll.
sentences.cn: 恋爱总是以少男巧遇少女这种传统的浪漫插曲开始的.

sentences.en: This was their closest approach to intimacy during their long Summer idyll.
sentences.cn: 在他们这段漫长的诗一样的夏日生活中,这是他们最亲密的一次接触了.

sentences.en: Though they still talked a lot, Harry felt that their idyll was drawing to an end.
sentences.cn: 尽管他们依然聊了很多，哈里却感到他们的浪漫插曲即将结束。

trans.tran_cn: 描写田园生活的短诗，一段愉快的乡村生活
